title: Clarify and document where the admin route is defined

requirements.text: Ensure the admin route location and paths are clearly documented for developers by keeping `frontend/src/ADMIN_ROUTES.md` accurate and adding a short pointer comment in `frontend/src/App.tsx` near the admin route definitions indicating that admin routes live there and referencing `frontend/src/ADMIN_ROUTES.md`.

quotes: muestrame en el chat cual es la ruta donde esta el admin

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/ADMIN_ROUTES.md` explicitly states that admin routes are defined in `frontend/src/App.tsx` and lists the admin paths: `/admin/login` and `/admin`.
`frontend/src/App.tsx` includes a brief comment near the admin route declarations (the `createRoute` blocks for `/admin/login` and `/admin`) pointing maintainers to `frontend/src/ADMIN_ROUTES.md`.

No changes are made to any files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, or `frontend/src/components/ui`.

constraints: Backend must remain single-actor; do not introduce additional canisters/services.
Do not modify files listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` from SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Changing admin authentication logic or session behavior.
Adding new admin pages or changing existing admin route URLs.
